title: (x) "epod" logo - (customized) Trade Gothic Cd {Yves}
content:
[http://www.method.com/method/case/identities\_case/case\_01\_G.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023204117/http:/www.method.com/method/case/identities_case/case_01_G.html)   
   
Anyone know what typeface this is? Also, are there any other typefaces that are similar? Perticularly, I like how the "d" doesn't have a foot and is just rounded.
author: sativo

comments.content:
[Proletarian](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023204117/http:/freethemes.tele.net/fonts/fonts/screens/op/proletariandl.htm) has the same footless style.   
   
And I think someone has asked about the epod logo before.

yves..   
   
show us your logo... please..

Dang! This looks a whole lot like a logo that I developped   
for the Programmatorische Overheidsdienst Maatschappelijke   
Integratie (POD), a government service for social inclusion.   
It didn't get used tho because the name changed. I'll try to post   
it soon.   
   
BTW I think this is customized Helvetica or Univers (I used   
the same trick for my logo). I can't check it right now.
Tomorrow morning when I'm back at work. G'night everyone!

Heh heh, I got it: it's customized [Trade Gothic Bold Condensed 20](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023204117/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/trade-gothic/bold-condensed-no-20/testdrive.html?s=epod&p=72).   
The "e" and "o" seem to match perfectly, and both "p" and "d"   
are custom (re)drawn.   
   
P.S. Forgot about the logo, I'll do it tomorrow. Sorry'boutthat.
